snippet: The state’s energy infrastructure is ailing, said Gil C. Quinones, chief of the New York Power Authority.
abstract: More than 500 engineers attend conference to seek ways to strengthen New York State's power grid; state is awash in generating capacity because the recession has stunted industrial demand, but the energy infrastructure is ailing; 42 percent of the state's power plants are more than 40 years old, and 22 percent are more than 50 years old.
lead_paragraph: The state’s energy infrastructure is ailing, said Gil C. Quinones, chief of the New York Power Authority.

headline.seo: Engineers Seek Ways to Fortify New York’s Power Grid
headline.main: Engineers Convene to Seek Ways to Strengthen New York State’s Power Grid
